dataList.content: As the prolonged cycles of pain came to an end...
The Abnormality has been successfully suppressed. We can return to the bus now.
It was a "success" that accompanied many deaths and revivals on our side, but I nodded anyway.
We got back on the bus, harboring a few unanswered questions.
You came back later than expected. I was just about to take my first nap in a while.
I explained the oddities we ran into earlier to Vergilius (To be more precise, Faust did the heavy lifting).
I was expecting him to coldly tell me to do my job as a middle manager and follow whatever orders I'm given, but his answer was surprisingly earnest.
...The existence of Abnormalities has been almost completely unknown to the public, and we don't possess all the details on them, either. Dante.
<Didn't think you'd admit it right away.>
Faust flinched a little, but she didn't relay what I just said.
Enigmatic as they are... Let's leave Ms. Faust and other departments of our proud Limbus company to uncover all the details about them in the future, why don't we.
...Will do.
Was Faust given any time to do any research on this job?
The mysteries were left unsolved, but...if Faust accepted the suggestion without a hitch, that probably means she's thought of a way.
You, why do you have your shoulders so hunched like that?
You're short enough as you are, and the shrunken posture makes you practically imperceptible.
...I hoped I could meet Sir Siegfried again...
(Who was Sir Sieg..fried, again?)
Wasn't that the man who took photos of himself while cutting us down with one hand?
(Right... That Zack Friture guy...?)
Ishmael was breathing noisily through the nose. The incident at the checkpoint must've left some deep grudges on her.
Eager I was to show him... mine valiant act of rescuing civilians...
I vowed that I will meet him again as a Fixer of noble cause...
Reunions are more touching if it's after a long time, Don Quixote. Try thinking that it's a good thing he didn't show up today.
It really is strange, though.
He's not one to miss spectacles with this many spectators around.
Oho... Is he kind of like a celebrity, then?
You could say that. He has a flair for showmanship, so it's usual for K Corp. to take advantage of these kinds of commotions by sending him.
But... If he hasn't shown up in this perfect opportunity to draw the public's full attention...
<It means this isn't something they want people to notice...>
I shan't...take such vicious slander of Sir Siegfried!
On the fifth row on page 42 of his autobiograph "A Hero Should Keep Smiling Until Their Last", he writes that he shall be there to aid the weak no matter when and where!
...Hah. Alright, you'd best hold that belief of yours dearly.
That way, you'll have something to hang on to when you face the extreme in the future.
